content.raw: ```full_validation_output```  is a list, not a char buffer... with ```print``` the list will just be appended to file as is, but if we use ```write```, it will need to be formatted somehow (perhaps in a loop) such that all items in ```full_validation_output``` (which is a list of tuples) are on the same line in a legible format, but a newline is also appended at the end. Seemed cleaner just to leave it as ```print```
content.html: full_validation_output is a list, not a char buffer... with print the list will just be appended to file as is, but if we use write, it will need to be formatted somehow (perhaps in a loop) such that all items in full_validation_output (which is a list of tuples) are on the same line in a legible format, but a newline is also appended at the end. Seemed cleaner just to leave it as print
